description: AWS Landing Zone features configuration - allows adding/removing features per configuration size

features.name: AWS Organizations
features.awsDefinition: A centralized cloud account management service that lets you consolidate multiple AWS accounts into an organization that you create and centrally manage.

features.name: AWS Control Tower
features.description: Landing zone setup and governance with guardrails
features.awsDefinition: A service that offers a straightforward way to set up and govern an AWS multi-account environment, following prescriptive best practices. Orchestrates AWS Organizations, Service Catalog, and IAM Identity Center.

features.name: Control Tower Custom Extensions
features.description: Advanced Control Tower customizations and extensions
features.awsDefinition: Advanced customizations for Control Tower including declarative policies, enhanced hook management, and custom account vending capabilities for enterprise environments.

features.name: Amazon GuardDuty
features.awsDefinition: A threat detection service that continuously monitors your AWS accounts and workloads for malicious activity using AI/ML with integrated threat intelligence from AWS and third parties.

features.name: AWS Security Hub
features.description: Centralized security findings and compliance dashboard
features.awsDefinition: A cloud security posture management service that performs automated, continuous security best practice checks and aggregates security alerts from various AWS services in a standardized format.

features.name: Amazon Inspector
features.awsDefinition: An automated vulnerability management service that continually scans AWS workloads for software vulnerabilities and unintended network exposure.

features.name: AWS Network Firewall
features.awsDefinition: A stateful, managed, network firewall and intrusion detection and prevention service for your Amazon VPC with deep packet inspection capabilities.

features.name: AWS Transit Gateway
features.description: Network transit hub for VPC connectivity
features.awsDefinition: A service that interconnects your virtual private clouds (VPCs) and on-premises networks, simplifying network management by centralizing connectivity in a hub-and-spoke architecture.

features.name: AWS Direct Connect
features.awsDefinition: Links your internal network to an AWS Direct Connect location over a standard Ethernet fiber-optic cable, providing a secure, high-bandwidth, low-latency connection that bypasses the public internet.

features.name: AWS Systems Manager
features.description: Operational data and automation across AWS resources
features.awsDefinition: Helps you centrally view, manage, and operate nodes at scale in AWS, on-premises, and multicloud environments with secure management without inbound ports or SSH keys.

features.name: CloudFormation StackSets
features.description: Deploy CloudFormation stacks across multiple accounts
features.awsDefinition: Extends CloudFormation functionality by enabling you to create, update, or delete stacks across multiple accounts and Regions with a single operation from a central administrator account.

features.name: Account Factory for Terraform (AFT)
features.awsDefinition: Sets up a Terraform pipeline to help you provision and customize accounts in AWS Control Tower, providing Terraform-based account provisioning while maintaining Control Tower governance.

features.name: Enhanced CloudWatch Monitoring
features.awsDefinition: Comprehensive monitoring service that retrieves metrics, monitors log files, sets alarms, and automatically reacts to changes in AWS resources with enhanced dashboards and alerting capabilities.

features.name: Organization-wide CloudTrail
features.description: Centralized audit logging across all accounts
features.awsDefinition: An AWS service that helps you enable operational and risk auditing, governance, and compliance by recording actions taken by users, roles, or AWS services as events across your organization.

features.name: Elasticsearch Service for Logging
features.description: Advanced log analytics and search capabilities
features.awsDefinition: A managed service (now Amazon OpenSearch Service) that makes it easy to deploy, operate, and scale Elasticsearch for log analytics, real-time application monitoring, and text search.
